body_html:
@fayeshine Yes, you are right, just tell somebody who has proxy but failed to compile tensorflow.

It will save a lot of time for the people who doesn't have a proxy.

But, I don't think the contributors of boringssl have the need to follow us transfer their coding place from google's site to github or this will waste their time, right?

Anyway, I only know this workaround with proxy.

I also want this useful library (tensorflow) to be easy to use for us who has been blocked from part of the Internet.

:-)

body:
@fayeshine Yes, you are right, just tell somebody who has proxy but failed to compile tensorflow.

It will save a lot of time for the people who doesn't have a proxy.

But, I don't think the contributors of `boringssl` have the need to follow us transfer their coding place from google's site to github or this will waste their time, right?

Anyway, I only know this workaround with proxy.

I also want this useful library (tensorflow) to be easy to use for us who has been blocked from part of the Internet.

:-)
